item.title: 特朗普关税冲击后，世界工厂中心陷入恐慌
item.description:
最贫穷国家的出口商正在努力应对订单被取消、生计被破坏以及不知道下一步该怎么办的困境。【原文：

Exporters in the poorest countries are grappling with cancelled orders, upended livelihoods and the impossibility of knowing what to do next.

item.title: 美联储威廉姆斯下调经济增长预期，上调通胀预期
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）表示，由于美国的关税政策和移民减少，他预计经济增长将放缓，失业率将上升，通胀率将回升。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said he expects slower economic growth, higher unemployment and a pickup in inflation due to US tariffs policy and reduced immigration.】

item.title: 波兰称资本市场应从私人储蓄中获得推动力
item.description: 波兰央行行长亚当-格拉平斯基（Adam Glapinski）表示，欧洲的家庭应该得到激励，将他们的部分储蓄转移到促进资本市场发展的地方。【原文：Households in Europe should get incentives to move some of their savings to boost capital markets, Poland’s central bank Governor Adam Glapinski said.】

item.title: 英国国家巴黎银行因政治和关税战下调南非经济增长预期
item.description: 由于国内政治的不确定性和美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税战，法国巴黎银行下调了南非的经济增长率。【原文：BNP Paribas slashed its economic growth for South Africa because of domestic political uncertainty and US President Donald Trump’s tariff war.】

item.title: 德州仪器、英特尔因中国关税打击美国产芯片而下挫
item.description: 周五，在中国宣布针对半导体进口征收新关税后，在美国设有生产工厂的芯片制造商股价下跌。【原文：Shares of chipmakers with US manufacturing plants fell Friday after China announced new tariffs, targeting semiconductor imports.】

item.title: 赖特称美国可削减伊朗石油供应并帮助填补缺口
item.description: 美国能源部长克里斯-赖特（Chris Wright）表示，美国的制裁措施可将伊朗的石油出口量削减至目前水平的四分之一，而全球供应商中的页岩油生产商将帮助填补这一缺口。【原文：US sanctions can slash Iran’s oil exports to a quarter of current levels, with shale producers among global suppliers that would help fill the gap, Energy Secretary Chris Wright said.】

item.title: Wi-Fi巨头TP-Link在美国的未来取决于其宣称与中国的分离
item.description: Wi-Fi 路由器无处不在，却常常被忽视，它是华盛顿最大的国家安全难题之一的核心，也是太平洋两岸两兄弟之间的裂痕。【原文：The ubiquitous but often overlooked Wi-Fi router lies at the heart of one of Washington’s biggest national security dilemmas — and a rift between two brothers on opposite sides of the Pacific.】

item.title: 特朗普的贸易战让美国农民对需求风险忧心忡忡
item.description: 乔希-约德（Josh Yoder）是俄亥俄州的第五代农民，随着唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）本周大幅升级对华贸易战，他一直在关注农作物市场的动向。约德仍然是特朗普的忠实支持者，但他也开始担心总统的策略是否会奏效。【原文：Josh Yoder, a fifth-generation farmer in Ohio, has been watching gyrations in the crop markets as Donald Trump moved to dramatically escalate his trade war with China this week. Yoder is still an ardent Trump supporter, but he’s also getting nervous about whether the president’s strategy is going to pay off.】

item.title: 关税升级导致中国航空公司推迟交付波音飞机
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国吉祥航空有限公司正在推迟交付一架波音公司的宽体飞机，这凸显了华盛顿和中国政府之间不断升级的贸易战如何推高了大宗商品的价格。【原文：China’s Juneyao Airlines Co. is delaying delivery of a Boeing Co. widebody aircraft, according to people familiar with the matter, highlighting how the escalating trade war between Washington and Beijing is driving up the price of big-ticket goods.】

item.title: 鳕鱼角一位立法者说，"欢乐时光 "禁令不好玩，必须终止
item.description: 马萨诸塞州是仅有的几个禁止餐馆提供欢乐时光特饮来吸引顾客的州之一。州参议员朱利安-赛尔（Julian Cyr）正在努力改变这一现状。【原文：Massachusetts is one of only a handful of states that prohibits restaurants from offering happy hour drink specials to lure in customers. State Senator Julian Cyr is on a mission to change that.】

item.title: 美联储穆萨莱姆释放通胀加剧、就业市场疲软的风险信号
item.description: 圣路易斯联邦储备银行行长阿尔贝托-穆萨莱姆说，近期存在通胀上升而劳动力市场疲软的风险，这要求决策者在监测新数据时保持警惕。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President Alberto Musalem said there’s a near-term risk that inflation will rise while the labor market weakens, requiring policymakers be vigilant as they monitor the incoming data.】

item.title: 物价预期飙升，美国消费者信心指数延续跌势
item.description: 美国消费者情绪跌至近三年来的最低点，而短期和长期通胀预期则因关税担忧加剧而飙升至数十年来的高点。【原文：US consumer sentiment tumbled to an almost three-year low while short- and long-term inflation expectations soared to multi-decade highs on growing tariff concerns.】

item.title: 阿布扎比的 Adnoc 据称将考虑竞购价值 90 亿美元的 Aethon 资产
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，阿布扎比国家石油公司正在研究竞购美国能源投资公司 Aethon Energy Management 的天然气资产。【原文：Abu Dhabi’s state oil firm is studying a bid for the natural gas assets of Aethon Energy Management, a US energy-focused investment firm, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国国债下跌，创 2019 年回购爆仓以来最严重跌势
item.description: 国债下跌，29 万亿美元的国债市场正走向自 2019 年美国金融体系动荡迫使美联储采取行动以来最严重的单周亏损。【原文：Treasuries fell, as the $29 trillion market heads toward its worst weekly loss since turmoil in the plumbing of the US financial system forced action from the Federal Reserve in 2019.】

item.description: 在 3 月的最后一周，优步公司（Uber Technologies Inc.【原文：Waymo robotaxis made up about 20% of rides offered by Uber Technologies Inc. in Austin in the last week of March, underscoring how consumers have warmed to the autonomous service since the companies launched a partnership early last month.】

item.title: 美联储主席柯林斯称关税影响比许多美国人看到的更广泛
item.description: 波士顿联邦储备银行行长苏珊-柯林斯（Susan Collins）表示，对进口商品征收关税对物价的影响将比许多美国人预期的要广泛。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Boston President Susan Collins said tariffs on imported goods will have a wider impact on prices than many Americans anticipate.】

item.title: 土耳其为保卫里拉烧掉 100 亿美元以应对全球关税升级
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普的关税计划引发的市场动荡可能使土耳其的外汇储备再损失 100 亿美元，增加了上个月国内政治危机造成的损失。【原文：The market turmoil triggered by Donald Trump’s tariff plans has probably cost Turkey another $10 billion in foreign-exchange reserves, adding to losses incurred last month amid a domestic political crisis.】

item.title: 皮布尔斯、麦克尼利为办公楼改住房筹集资金
item.description: 由开发商唐-皮布尔斯（Don Peebles）和前凯雷集团（Carlyle Group Inc.【原文：A new investment firm started by developer Don Peebles and former Carlyle Group Inc. partner Doug McNeely is seeking to raise as much as $1.5 billion to convert offices to housing across the US.】

item.title: 拉加德告诉各国财政部长让欧盟在贸易谈判中发挥主导作用
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）告诉该地区的财长们，让布鲁塞尔在与美国的贸易讨论中发挥主导作用。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde told the region’s finance ministers to let Brussels take the lead on trade discussions with the US, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克通过出售 X 债务为摩根士丹利带来盈利增长
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）愿意与埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）坚持到底，这为其第一季度业绩带来了健康的推动力。【原文：Morgan Stanley’s willingness to stick it out with Elon Musk is giving its first-quarter results a healthy boost.】

item.title: 德国推动本土防空系统发展以抵消 "爱国者 "计划的影响
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，德国政府正在向制造商代傲公司施压，要求其加快研发一种国产、射程更远的防空系统，以减少对美国制造的 "爱国者 "设备的依赖。【原文：Germany’s government is pressing manufacturer Diehl to accelerate development of a homegrown, longer-range air-defense system to reduce its reliance on US-made Patriot units, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 印度探讨在 90 天内达成美国临时贸易协定
item.description: 据一位高级官员称，如果双方互惠互利，印度可以在 90 天内与唐纳德-特朗普政府达成临时贸易协定，这增加了南亚国家相对不受华盛顿关税战略影响的希望。【原文：India can reach a provisional trade agreement with the Donald Trump administration in 90 days if the offers are mutually beneficial, according to a senior official, boosting hopes that the South Asian nation can emerge relatively unscathed from Washington’s tariff strategy.】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行对 Axa IM 交易的资本处理方案遭欧洲央行反对
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，欧洲中央银行对实施一项规则持否定态度，该规则可能会减少法国巴黎银行计划收购安盛资产管理公司（Axa SA）对其资本金的影响。【原文：The European Central Bank has taken a negative view on applying a rule that might have reduced the impact on BNP Paribas SA’s capital from its planned acquisition of Axa SA’s asset manager, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 尼日利亚独善其身，非洲暂停关税引发的货币干预措施
item.description: 即使美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税政策颠覆了市场和全球贸易，非洲国家也没有急于支撑本国货币和动用有限的外汇储备。【原文：African nations aren’t rushing to prop up their local currencies and tap their limited foreign-exchange reserves, even as US President Donald Trump’s tariffs upend markets and global trade.】

item.title: 特朗普能源部长称对油价的担忧是错误的
item.description: 美国能源部长克里斯-赖特说，石油市场的下跌被夸大了，他预计美国原油生产商将继续增产。【原文：US Energy Secretary Chris Wright said the selloff in the oil market is overblown, and he expects American crude produces to keep increasing production.】

item.title: 美联储卡什卡利认为失调不值得干预
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行行长尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）表示，他没有看到国债市场出现值得美国央行干预的压力。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari said he’s not seeing stresses in the Treasury market that would merit an intervention by the US central bank.】

item.title: 受能源拖累，美国生产者价格意外下跌
item.description: 美国 3 月份的批发价格意外创下 2023 年 10 月以来的最大降幅，受到能源成本的抑制，为关税浪潮前的温和通胀增添了证据。【原文：US wholesale prices unexpectedly fell in March by the most since October 2023, restrained by energy costs and adding to evidence of tame inflation leading up to a wave of tariffs.】

item.title: 巴西通胀创两年新高，加息规模存疑
item.description: 巴西上个月的年通胀率略高于预期，达到两年来的最高水平，这给正在考虑下一次加息幅度的决策者们带来了压力。【原文：Brazil’s annual inflation accelerated slightly more than expected last month, hitting its highest level in two years and pressuring policymakers as they mull the size of their next interest rate hike.】

item.title: 西北大学收到 100 份联邦项目停工令
item.description: 西北大学表示，获得联邦拨款的研究人员收到了 100 份停工令，包括医学和工程学领域的项目都受到了影响。【原文：Northwestern University said researchers with federal grants received 100 stop-work orders, hitting projects in areas including medicine and engineering.】
